_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Woodworth Inc.

Pontiac, MI  48341

RMP Facility ID: 1000 0022 1869

    

Executive Summary



Woodworth Inc. has prepared this executive summary in conformance with the provisions of 40 CFR 68.155.



1.    Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:

Woodworth Inc. adheres to the Federal and State regulations and in compliance with the OSHA requirements for handling of anhydrous ammonia and the OSHA process management standard.  Employees of the facility are trained in their roles and responsibilities in implementing prevention and emergency response.  Should an emergency occur, it is the company's policy to notify the City of Pontiac Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency situation.

2.    Stationary source and regulated substances handled:

Anhydrous ammonia is stored in a bulk tank at the facility.  The facility is a commercial emulsion and dispersant manufacturing facility.

3.    The worst case release scenario and the alternative release scenario including the administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for release have been prepared and submitted as required.  This data may be viewed onsite.  

4.    The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

The design, installation and maintenance of the anhydrous ammonia tank is performed in conformance with ANSI standards, state and local regulations.  Facility personnel have been trained in safe handling procedures of the chemical.  The facility is in compliance with the applicable regulations.  The loading of anhydrous ammonia is conducted with extreme safety.  All the transfer operations are monitored and follow a written standard operating procedure (SOP).

5.    The five-year accident history:

None.

6.    The emergency response program:

In the event of an emergency, the facility will immediately notify the Waterford Fire Department for emergency response measures.

7.    Planned

changes to improve safety:

The Facility will train their employees on an ongoing basis.  The safety systems and preventive measures are constantly evaluated and improved.  This facility also expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of the PSM/RMP program.  All recommendations during the Process Hazard Analysis were designed to improve the safety performance of the ammonia process.  Woodworth Inc. will evaluate each recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of an unintentional release.
